hadcol 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • cdsbcol

Add a colum to a data frame

add_col.Rd

Similar to base::cbind, but allows you to specify the position. Will replace existing variable with the same name if present.

add_col(x, name, value, where = ncol(x) + 1)

Arguments

x

A base::data.frame
name

Name of variable to create. If variable of that name already exists
value

Values to insert.
where

position to insert. Use 1 to insert on LHS. Default RHS.

See also

hadcol::insert_into()

Other xyz: insert_into

Examples

df <- data.frame(x = 1:5)
add_col(df, "y", runif(5))
#>   x           y
#> 1 1 0.080750138
#> 2 2 0.834333037
#> 3 3 0.600760886
#> 4 4 0.157208442
#> 5 5 0.007399441
add_col(df, "y", runif(5), where = 1)
#>           y x
#> 1 0.4663935 1
#> 2 0.4977774 2
#> 3 0.2897672 3
#> 4 0.7328820 4
#> 5 0.7725215 5

add_col(df, "x", 5:1)
#>   x
#> 1 5
#> 2 4
#> 3 3
#> 4 2
#> 5 1
